intro: Stenocoelium tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaf stenocoelium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
